When I asked a likewise question the answer was that we are only testing ou=
r own interfaces. Therefore, you are not testing that the connection to the=
 database or the that the database actually works - we assume they do becau=
se they are out of our scope. This of course assumes you are not writing yo=
ur own JDBC driver.

I was pointed to using mock objects and the like; howe=
ver what I ended up doing is using setup to run scripts that put specific i=
nformation into the database to test conditions that I wanted - in essence =
juicing the data to test the handling of that data under a limited number o=
f conditions.
